benchmark_details.name: EPD (European Patent Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: EPD is a dataset of English-language patents granted by the European Patent Office (EPO) in 2024, designed to support various patent-related tasks, including claim generation. It provides high-quality, legally validated claims that fill a gap for cross-jurisdiction evaluation of language models on patent tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for training language models to generate patent claims and support various patent-related tasks using high-quality legal data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The EPD dataset only includes patents published by the European Patent Office and documented in English.

data.source: European Patent Office (EPO) Open Patent Services (OPS)
data.annotation: Legally validated claims sourced directly from the EPO, ensuring high quality.

methods: Evaluation with traditional metrics (BLEU, ROUGE, BERTScore)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the overlap between generated claims and reference claims for text generation tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating claims that align with legal standards.
methodology.baseline_results: Models fine-tuned on EPD consistently outperform those trained on other datasets.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of EPD is validated through comparative performance evaluations with existing datasets.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset is sourced from publicly accessible documents and does not include private information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC-BY-NC-4.0 license is planned for the dataset.
